plugin.commands.name: project lists
plugin.commands.description: creates/updates a human-readable list of project notes, including basic tasks statistics and time until next review, and time until the project is due to complete.
arguments: comma-separated list of setting keys and their values (optional)
position to scroll window to (optional, only for HTML view)

plugin.commands.name: onMessageFromHTMLView
plugin.commands.description: Projects: Callback function to receive messages from HTML view

plugin.commands.name: start reviews
plugin.commands.description: start a new series of reviews, deciding which are now ready for review, and kicking off the first one

plugin.commands.name: finish project review
plugin.commands.description: updates the currently open project's @reviewed() date

plugin.commands.name: next project review
plugin.commands.description: updates this project's @reviewed() date, and jump to next project to review

plugin.commands.name: skip project review
plugin.commands.description: skip this review, add a @nextReview() date, and jump to next project to review

plugin.commands.name: pause project toggle
plugin.commands.description: Toggles paused status by adding or removing '#paused' in the open project note. If paused, it won't be offered as a project to review

plugin.commands.name: complete project
plugin.commands.description: adds @completed(date) to the open project note, adds its details to a yearly note in Summaries folder (if the folder exists), and offers to move the note to the NotePlan Archive

plugin.commands.name: cancel project
plugin.commands.description: adds @cancelled(date) date to the open project note, adds its details to a yearly note in Summaries folder (if the folder exists), and offers to move the note to the NotePlan Archive

plugin.commands.name: add progress update
plugin.commands.description: prompts for a short description and percentage completion number for the open project note, and writes it to the metadata area of the note

plugin.settings.title: What do you want to Review?
Hashtags to review
plugin.settings.description:
A comma-separated list of hashtags to indicate notes to include in this review system.
If this setting is empty, then it will include all notes for review that include a `@review(...)` string.
If it is set (e.g. `#project, #area`), then it will include just those notes which also have one or more of those tags.

plugin.settings.title: Folders to use in reviews
plugin.settings.description:
Specify which folders to include (which includes any of their sub-folders) as a comma-separated list. This match is done anywhere in the folder name, so you could simply say `Project` which would match for `Client A/Projects` as well as `Client B/Projects`.
Note: if you specify the root folder `/` this only includes the root folder itself, and not all its sub-folders.
If empty, all folders will be used apart from those in the next setting.

plugin.settings.title: Folders to ignore in reviews
plugin.settings.description:
If 'Folders to use in reviews' above is empty, then this setting specifies folders to ignore (which includes any of their sub-folders too) as a comma-separated list. This match is also done anywhere in the folder name. Can be empty.
Note: if you specify the root folder `/` this only ignores the root folder, and not all sub-folders.
Note: the special @Trash, @Templates and @Archive folders are always excluded.

plugin.settings.title: Output style to use
plugin.settings.description:
Use 'Rich' (HTML) output (an experimental style available from NotePlan v3.7).
Or use NotePlan's original 'Markdown' output style.
Note: the 'Rich' output can't result in a saved note, so that's why there's also an option to do both.

plugin.settings.title: Project Display order
plugin.settings.description: The ordering options are by 'due' date, by next 'review' date or 'title'.

plugin.settings.title: Display projects grouped by folder?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to group the projects by their folder.

plugin.settings.title: Hide top-level folder in output?
plugin.settings.description: If 'Display projects grouped by folder?' (above) is set, this hides all but the lowest-level subfolder name in output.

plugin.settings.title: How to show completed/cancelled projects?
plugin.settings.description: If you do not want to see completed/cancelled projects in your Rich dashboard, change this setting to something other than Displayed.

plugin.settings.title: Only display due projects/areas?
plugin.settings.description: If not ticked then it will display all project/area notes, not just due ones.

plugin.settings.title: Display project dates?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to display the project's review and due dates (where set).

plugin.settings.title: Display project's latest progress?
plugin.settings.description: Whether to show the project's latest progress (where available). If a specific 'Progress:' field is set it will use that, otherwise it will calculate %completion based on the number of completed and open tasks.

plugin.settings.title: Folder to store (markdown) review notes
plugin.settings.description: Folder where review notes will be stored (will be created if necessary)

plugin.settings.title: Window width
plugin.settings.description: Width of the Review List window (pixels)

plugin.settings.title: Window height
plugin.settings.description: Height of the Review List window (pixels)

plugin.settings.title: Confirm next Review?
plugin.settings.description: When running '/next project review' it asks whether to start the next review.

plugin.settings.title: Finished List Heading
plugin.settings.description: Heading of list of completed or cancelled projects/areas in the yearly note

plugin.settings.title: Archive using folder structure?
plugin.settings.description:
When you complete or cancel a project, and you opt to move it to the Archive, if set this will replicating the project note's existing folder structure inside the Archive.
(This is the same thing that the Filer plugin's "/archive note using folder structure" command does, though Filer does not need to be installed to use this.)

plugin.settings.title: Project start string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date a project/area was started (default: '@start')

plugin.settings.title: Project completed string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date a project/area was completed (default: '@completed')

plugin.settings.title: Project cancelled string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date a project/area was cancelled (default: '@cancelled')

plugin.settings.title: Project due string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date a project/area is due to be finished (default: '@due')

plugin.settings.title: Project review interval string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating review interval for project/area (default: '@review')

plugin.settings.title: Project reviewed string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date a project/area was last reviewed (default: '@reviewed')

plugin.settings.title: Project next review string
plugin.settings.description: @string indicating date you next want a project/area to be reviewed (default: '@nextReview')

plugin.settings.title: Log Level
plugin.settings.description: Set how much output will be displayed for this plugin in the NotePlan > Help > Plugin Console. DEBUG is the most verbose; NONE is the least (silent).
